messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/UserController.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\UserController@update` is implemented to process HTTP requests. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
Full path
- /v1/users/{user}

All methods?
- all_methods: false

Per-method acceptability (based only on the route definitions in the provided code)
- HEAD: false
- POST: false
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true
- PUT: true
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: true

Explanation
- The routes are defined inside routes/api.php with a prefix('v1'), so the resource path is /v1/users/{user}.
- The update action is registered with Route::apiResource('users', UserController::class)->only('update') inside the authenticated middleware group. Laravel's apiResource registers update as the PUT and PATCH methods for the /users/{user} path â€” therefore PUT and PATCH are acceptable for this endpoint.
- There is also a separate apiResource('users')->only(['index','show']) outside the auth group which registers a GET /v1/users/{user} route that maps to UserController@show. Because that GET route is explicitly present in the code, GET is acceptable for the same path.
- No route definition in the provided files declares POST, DELETE, OPTIONS, TRACE, or HEAD for /v1/users/{user}. The "all methods" override is not used (no Route::any or equivalent), so all_methods is false.
- The HEAD method is not explicitly defined in the code (the GET route is present, but per instructions we do not infer implicit HEAD handling), so HEAD is reported false.
